deletion_details.item_text: Apply for a Commonwealth Seniors Health Card once you have reached the Age Pension age

right_box_analysis.continuous_line_description: Line crosses through the second item regarding deeming rates.

deletion_details.item_text: A Commonwealth Seniors Health Card is income tested on taxable income and deemed income from account-based pensions.
Deeming rates if you are single â€“ financial assets up to $64,200 have a deeming rate of 0.75% applied, anything over $64,200 is deemed at 2.75%. If you are a couple, the threshold is $106,200.

Eg if you are single and have $1,064,200 in superannuation, the first $64,200 is deemed at 0.75% = $481.50 and the remaining $1,000,000 is deemed at 2.75% = $27,500 + $481.50 = $27,981.50. This falls below the $101,105 single limit so in this scenario, you will be able to successfully apply for a Commonwealth Seniors Health card.

row_deletion_rule.explanation: Both boxes have diagonal marks, so the entire row should be deleted.

visual_description: The left box has a diagonal line crossing through the text. The right box has a diagonal line crossing through the second item regarding deeming rates.
